key_points: A Michigan middle school staff member was arrested for leaving threatening notes, including a school threat.
The staff member, who remains unnamed pending charges, was caught on security camera footage.
Lakeview Public Schools Superintendent Karl Paulson informed families of the incident in a letter.
One note seemed to be a false threat aimed at closing the school; no lockdowns or safety protocols were initiated.
The incident follows a history of school threats in Michigan, notably after the Oxford High School shooting.
Recent nationwide school closures were prompted by anonymous shooting and bomb threats on TikTok.
Superintendent Paulson expressed extreme disappointment in the staff member involved.
The school district is cooperating with police in the ongoing investigation.
Macomb County Prosecutor Peter Lucido suggests there's enough evidence for several charges and questions the staff member's motives.
Lucido emphasizes the incident's negative impact, given current concerns over school safety.
